headline: Bill would make it harder for bar to discipline lawyers
author: Associated Press
sentences: Under Leach's bill, the State Bar of Arizona would be required to pay for attorney fees, investigation and court costs, the loss of future earnings and damage to a lawyer's reputation if the bar pursues discipline but doesn't win the case.
PHOENIX - Arizona Senate Republicans have voted to require the state bar to pay attorney fees and other costs if the bar seeks to discipline a lawyer and ends up losing.
Republican Sen. Vince Leach introduced the bill after Democratic Secretary of State Katie Hobbs filed a bar complaint against Republican Attorney General Mark Brnovich.
The measure approved Wednesday has the potential to discourage investigations of attorneys accused of ethical violations or other misbehavior.
Hobbs said Brnovich and lawyers in his office broke attorney ethics rules while representing her in cases related to the 2020 election.
Brnovich signed a diversion agreement that requires him to take unspecified actions to keep his law license in good standing.
He says in looking into it he found others were also taking advantage of that system.
Leach says Hobbs “weaponized” the bar complaint system by targeting Brnovich.
